page.title: 01DENBIGH:GENERAL DESCRIPTION.
page.content: The area lies in the heart of a{rift {valley}called the{Vale of Clwyd.}The town of{Denbigh}lies to the South of the block.This is a thriving market town with a population of{9000}which attracts people from the mainly {agricultural}countryside surrounding it.The most important historical monuments are the remains of the {castle}and the{Carmelite Friary}which were built during the{13th century. } {Sir Henry Morton Stanley}(1841-1904) the explorer was born here as was{ {Thomas Myddleton}(1550-1631) who became an M.P. and Lord Mayor of London. A small{industrial estate}situated on the outskirts of the town provides a minor source of{employment}but the future probably depends upon the area becoming a thriving{tourist centre.
